means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利克地貌名称，来源于古诺斯语，含义是“溪流”(brook)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利克职业名称，韭葱种植者或销售者，来源于古英语

sentence.Network_en: She had to eat the leek then.
What he said is not worth a leek.
Harvey felt bad when he was obliged to eat the leek.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈维被迫忍受屈辱心里很难受.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lēac, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch look and German Lauch

entry.def: Leeks are long thin vegetables which smell similar to onions. They are white at one end, have long light green leaves, and are eaten cooked.

means.word_mean: 1. plant having a large slender white bulb and flat overlapping dark green leaves; used in cooking; believed derived from the wild Allium ampeloprasum
2. related to onions; white cylindrical bulb and flat dark-green leaves
